item.title: UK economy rebounds as Covid restrictions ease
item.description: Retail, restaurants and hotels show strong growth between April and June but data misses forecasts.

item.title: Boohoo boss: 'We're not a throwaway fashion brand'
item.description: The boss of fast fashion retailer Boohoo tells the BBC it is committed to being more sustainable.

item.title: Cryptocurrency heist hacker returns $260m in funds
item.description: The hacker behind the $600m Poly Network cryptocurrency heist has posted a Q&A on the blockchain.

item.title: China says crackdown on business to go on for years
item.description: The five-year plan comes soon after a major clampdown on several big technology and education firms.

item.title: Quarantine hotel rules face legal challenge
item.description: Travellers affected by the UK's quarantine hotel policy want a judicial review of the rules.

item.title: Google may cut pay of staff who work from home
item.description: The tech giant has developed a calculator that lets staff see the effects of remote working.

item.title: Weight Watchers shares dive as people put diets on hold
item.description: Shares in the Oprah Winfrey-backed company drop 25% as subscriber numbers fall after lockdown.

item.title: Post Office to fight six appeals in IT scandal
item.description: More appeal cases are being heard after hundreds of sub-postmasters were wrongly accused of stealing.

item.title: White House urges action on oil as gasoline prices rise
item.description: The global recovery could falter if major oil-producing nations do not increase supply, says the White House.

item.title: Morrisons to give workers Boxing Day off
item.description: The supermarket chain has given all its 111,000 staff the day off as a reward for their work during the pandemic.

item.title: David Cameron in row over promoting genetics firm Illumina
item.description: Mr Cameron encouraged Matt Hancock to speak at a conference co-hosted by Illumina before it won a government contract.

item.title: Deliveroo orders double as lockdown habits endure
item.description: First results from the newly floated food delivery firm see first-half losses narrow to £104.8m.

item.title: Winchester is now the least affordable UK city to buy a home
item.description: Winchester has leapfrogged Oxford to become the UK’s least affordable city to buy a home, says a survey.

item.title: Working from home job adverts rise
item.description: Recruitment firms say an increasing number of jobseekers now expect flexible working "as the norm".

item.title: CEO Secrets: Foot Locker boss shares his advice
item.description: Richard Johnson, CEO of Foot Locker, reflects on the lessons of the pandemic for business leaders.

item.title: Sharing apps are booming but will the kindness continue?
item.description: The pandemic sparked a surge in activity for sharing apps like Olio but has the trend run its course?

item.title: Can technology help authors write a book?
item.description: Writing a novel is notoriously difficult, but technology may give the writer a helping hand.

item.title: The activist entrepreneurs running zero-waste shops
item.description: Environmentally conscious entrepreneurs explain the movement towards zero-waste lifestyles.

item.title: Why artificial intelligence is being used to write adverts
item.description: Advertisers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to come up with their winning slogans.

item.title: Plain sailing: Boating holidays on the rise across the UK
item.description: More people are hiring boats to travel along the UK's canals and rivers amid travel restrictions.
